p: According to the global burden of disease (GBD) report of 2015, cancer is the second leading cause of death globally [ 66]. The global statistics show that 18.1 million new cases of breast cancer and 9.6 million deaths were reported in 2018. Breast cancer accounts up to 38.5% of female cancers [ 67]. It was also estimated that globally in next 5 years, the prevalence of breast cancer will be around 43.8 million [ 68]. Despite the incidence rate being low, the mortality rate of breast cancer among black African people remains higher than 40% [ 69].
